docs.text: Home Welcome Triple 10 Games Presents Our new game of 2022/2023, a fun cooking simulation sure to get everyone in a tisy. With quick platimes and fast paced action it's fun for anyone, and really easy to learn! Jump on in, have 5 minutes of fun to try and serve as many customers as you can and then watch friends and family struggle to beat your highscore. Click on the link below to give it a try! Try our Game! Follow along with our design! Click on the link below to follow along with our work flow and see what new design and workflow desisions get made each week. On the page below you should find all the links for any of the documentation you might be curious about. Follow development! Files Assessment 1 Type of File Link Jar File JAR Requirements Req1 Architecture Arch1 Method Selection and Planning Plan1 Risk Assessment Risk1 Implementation Impl1 GitHub Repository (Assessment 1) Repo Assessment 2 Type of File Link GitHub Repository (Assessment 2) Repo Website Changes Team 27 (BlackCatStudios) has taken over Team 30's (Triple10) website and game. The website was previously made up of html documents. Team 27 decided to convert the documents to markdown and use material for mkdocs to build the page. This has been done because the team already had experience with mkdocs as we used it for our website for assessment 1 and because html can be used directly in markdown. Mkdocs provides useful functionality which make the website easier to create and use.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Game Try our Game! Using the link below you can download a JAR executable file of our game for you to try. It a simple game that doesn't take long to play and even less time to learn. Challenge your friends to beat your score or keep trying to beat your own! Try our Game!
docs.title: Game

docs.text: Meet the Team Team Triple 10 This team developed the initial scenario mode of the game for assessment 1 We are a team of computer scientists from the Univeristy of York. Over the course of the last couple of terms we have been meeting regularly to complete and develop our own game inspired by overcooked. On this website you can find all the information about our development cycle that you'll need as well as an insight into how we went about creating our game. Hope you enjoy your stay! Team BlackCatStudios This team took over development of the game for assessment 2
docs.title: Meet the Teams
